Description: Pottery vase of straw tempered Nile silt with conical body, pointed stump base and everted rim; roughly made.
Curator's comments: This vase is from Garstang’s excavations in the Fort Cemetery at Hierakonpolis, but was not found within a grave and is marked only with F (for Fort) on the exterior. For publication of the surviving records of Garstang’s excavations see B. Adams, The Fort Cemetery at Hierakonpolis, London (1987). Most like Late ware L31D in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery
Acquisition name: Donated by: Frederick George Hilton Price
